medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent abdominal pain with severe pain in the right and left lower quadrants.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's abdominal pain began 10 days ago, initially in the epigastric region, and migrated to the right and left lower quadrants a couple of days later. The pain has been intermittent and today is reported as severe. The patient also reports bloating sensation, experienced constipation initially, and diarrhea for the past week. There has been intermittent discomfort with urination, without frequency or burning. Occasional night sweats have been noted over the past 10 days. No fever or vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Left inguinal hernia, shoulder fracture, clavicle stress fracture, supraventricular tachycardia, two epidural steroid injections, low back pain from an L4-L5 disc herniation.
medical_history.family_history: Father has hypertension and hyperlipidemia; paternal grandmother had hepatic cancer; paternal grandfather had myocardial infarction.
